title: The Causal Topography of Cognition
abstract: The causal structure of cognition can be simulated but not implemented computationally, just as the causal structure of a comet can be simulated but not implemented computationally. The only thing that allows us even to imagine otherwise is that cognition, unlike a comet, is invisible (to all but the cognizer).
histories: 11 pages, 0 figures, 10 references, Journal of Cognitive Science 13 2012
